meanings.definition: To surpass in height or amount.
meanings.sent1: The tall tree overtops all the others in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper overtops all the buildings in the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe overtops the other animals at the zoo with its long neck.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition overtops the challenges she faces, reaching new heights.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak overtops the surrounding landscape, majestic and grand.

meanings.sent1: The loud music overtops the conversation in the room.
meanings.sent2: His charisma overtops all other candidates in the election.
meanings.sent3: The bright colors of the painting overtrop the dullness of the room.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter overtrops the gloominess of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds overtrop the clear sky, casting a shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: To rise above or extend beyond.
meanings.sent1: The kite overtops the trees as it soars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: His achievements overtrop his initial expectations.
meanings.sent3: The hot air balloon overtrops the buildings, offering a unique view.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness overtrops any negativity, spreading warmth to all around.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall overtrops the rocks, cascading down with power and grace.
